clueServer
Class Users

java.lang.Object
  clueServer.Users

public class Users
extends Object

Class semantics and roles:
The Users class is responsible for maintaining references to all of the Player objects.
It is through the Users class that Players and their corresponding sockets and information are accessed.
(An important task for the Users object is to log the order in which players connect to the server-side program. This is accomplished by the use of the array: the index is the connection order.)

Information maintenance:
Creation: The Users object is created, and there is only one, when the Server is started.
Deletion: The Users object is destroyed when the system is shut down

Author:
Michael Philippone (Class Skeletons), Erich Schudt (Code)

Method Summary
 void assignPieces()
          Deprecated. this assignment of piece names occurs when the players connect, see the createPlayer method for this class ^^ above ^^
 void createPlayer(String username, Socket sock)
          Purpose: Create an additional player instance in the array

Precondition: There is an array of some number of players between 0 and 5
Postcondition: There is one more player added and the player has its thread started
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
-> put the number of connected users into "INDEX"
-> create a Player object in element INDEX + 1 of Player object array
-> start the newly created Player thread
END
 int getOrder(String username)
          Purpose: Get the index of a player in the user array

Preconditions: There are objects in the player array
Postconditions: There is a number known for a particular player
Pseudo-Code:
FOR each element in the array of players:
--> IF the element is not null and it has a playername that matches the search paramete:
--> --> return the number of the element
--> ELSE :
--> --> return -1
END
(Added 2 DEC 2008, Erich Schudt)

 Player getPlayer(String name, boolean searchByPiece)
          Purpose: Get an instance of a Player in the user array based on the playerName or pieceName field

Preconditions: There are objects in the player array
Postconditions: There is a number known for a particular player
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
- IF searching by piece name:
- - FOR each element in the array of players:
- - - IF the element is not null and it has a pieceName that matches the search parameter:
- - - - return the player at that element
- ELSE:
- - FOR each element in the array of players:
- - - IF the element is not null and it has a playerName that matches the search parameter:
- - - - return the player at that element
- return NULL (if we get this point, none of the Players in the array match)
END
(Added 12 DEC 2008, Michael Philippone)

Constructor Detail

Users

public Users(Server serv)
Default Constructor:
Takes 0 arguments.
Purpose: create a working instance of a Users object
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
-> point internal Server reference to parameter reference -> null out the whole array of Player objects
-> instantiate a ServerListener object
-> start the ServerListener listening
END

Parameters:
serv - a reference to the Server object for the Game
Method Detail

createPlayer

public void createPlayer(String username,
                         Socket sock)
Purpose: Create an additional player instance in the array

Precondition: There is an array of some number of players between 0 and 5
Postcondition: There is one more player added and the player has its thread started
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
-> put the number of connected users into "INDEX"
-> create a Player object in element INDEX + 1 of Player object array
-> start the newly created Player thread
END

Parameters:
username - the username String of the connecting player
sock - the socket that the Player object is to communicate over

update

public void update(int[] affectedPlayerNums,
                   String message)
Purpose: Update Client game state via client socket in appropriate player(s). The message is in an unparsed form and should be parsed to determine nature of communication (ie: guess, accuse, board update)
Precondition: Game is playing
Postcondition: The appropriate player(s) have had their socket(s) used to send a message to the corresponding Client Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
-> FOR each Player object in the array:
-> -> write the message (passed in as a parameter) to the current Player object's socket
END

Parameters:
affectedPlayerNums - an array of integers specifying the playerArr indices of those players with which to communicate
message - the unparsed message String to send to the client

updateAll

public void updateAll(String message)
Purpose: Update Client game state via client socket in all player(s).
Precondition: Game is playing
Postcondition: All player(s) have had their socket(s) used to send a message to the corresponding Client Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
- FOR each Player object in the array:
- - write the message (passed in as a parameter) to the current Player object's socket
- sleep for 2 seconds to allow other communications to catch up. (a weird fix to an untraceable error)
END

Parameters:
message - the unparsed message String to send to all clients

usersCount

public int usersCount()
Purpose: Get the number of Player objects currently maintained by the Users class

Preconditions: There are objects in array
Postconditions: the number of non-null elements is known
Pseudo-Code:
FOR all elements in player array:
--> IF the current element is not null:
--> --> increment the number of players by 1
return the number of players
END
(Added 19 NOV 2008, Michael Philippone)

Returns:
the number of Player objects currently maintained

getOrder

public int getOrder(String username)
Purpose: Get the index of a player in the user array

Preconditions: There are objects in the player array
Postconditions: There is a number known for a particular player
Pseudo-Code:
FOR each element in the array of players:
--> IF the element is not null and it has a playername that matches the search paramete:
--> --> return the number of the element
--> ELSE :
--> --> return -1
END
(Added 2 DEC 2008, Erich Schudt)

Parameters:
username - the user name of the client
Returns:
index the number index of the array which is the order of the current player or -1 if an error exists

assignPieces

public void assignPieces()
Deprecated. this assignment of piece names occurs when the players connect, see the createPlayer method for this class ^^ above ^^

Purpose: Assign a piece name to a player

Precondition: There are some number of Player objects in the playerArr array and they already have usernames (from the initial connection)
Postcondition: the players have piece names assigned to them
Pseudo-Code:
FOR all elements in the playerArr array:
--> IF the array element is NOT null:
--> --> Assign the Player object's pieceName with the corresponding piece name from the Utilities pieceNames array
END
(Added 2 DEC 2008, Erich Schudt)
(MOD 08 DEC 2008, Michael Philippone)

getPlayer

public Player getPlayer(String name,
                        boolean searchByPiece)
Purpose: Get an instance of a Player in the user array based on the playerName or pieceName field

Preconditions: There are objects in the player array
Postconditions: There is a number known for a particular player
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
- IF searching by piece name:
- - FOR each element in the array of players:
- - - IF the element is not null and it has a pieceName that matches the search parameter:
- - - - return the player at that element
- ELSE:
- - FOR each element in the array of players:
- - - IF the element is not null and it has a playerName that matches the search parameter:
- - - - return the player at that element
- return NULL (if we get this point, none of the Players in the array match)
END
(Added 12 DEC 2008, Michael Philippone)

Parameters:
name - the username of the Player to return
searchByPiece - whether or not hte given string parameter is a piece name to search on or a player name
Returns:
the player with the given username

Postconditions: There is a number known for a particular player
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
FOR each element in the array of players:
--> IF the element is not null and it has a playername that matches the search parameter:
--> --> return the element
--> ELSE :
--> --> return NULL
END
(Added 12 DEC 2008, Michael Philippone)

Parameters:
p_num - the number of the array element of the sought-after Player
Returns:
the player with the given username
